phrase: Enter the height in pixels that you would like to reserve for the logo in the header.
This path describes the location of the main logo image used in the header of all pages.
This property controls the browser background and text.
This path represents either the relative or absolute path to images used by the XenForo user interface. You may change this to point to a CDN if you wish.
The values specified here will be applied to items selected for inline moderation.
Controls the amount of separation between items in link groups.
Individual links within link groups, as defined above.
This property applies to the user avatar shown in member list items.
Sometimes, info about a post or thread etc. will be shown inside a member list item. This applies styling to that content.
Width of fixed column in extended member list items
On occasions, extra content is added to member list items. Use this to restyle it.
Applied in addition to the regular username styling.
Controls the style of the container for everything in the member list item except the user avatar.
This property is applied to the contain for all user info underneath the main username link.
Applies to the main username link on member list items.
User titles in member list items are styled with this property.
Controls the appearance of the container for member list items.
The smaller text that sometimes appears below the main menu title.
The large text that appears at the top of pop-up menus.
The minimum height for pop-up menus.
Defines the minimum width for all pop-up menus.
The main container for the pop-up part of pop-up menus.
Styles the block that surrounds the large avatar for a message author.
This is used to enclose the message text and any other user-generated content for the message, such as attached files.
Controls the appearance of the (optional) extra user info that can be displayed under the message poster's avatar and username.

This element contains the content area of the message template.
In the default style, it is used to enclose the right column of the message template, which contains the message text and controls.
This styles the block that displays the summary of users who have liked the message.
This is the container used for lists of messages.
Defines the appearance of message controls such as Edit, Delete, Like, Reply.
This block sits below the main content area and includes the inline moderation checkbox, permalink and message controls.
Notices are used to display information such as the message being in the moderation queue, or being deleted.
Container for controls generally seen only by privileged visitors - Edit, Delete, IP etc.
Container for controls seen by general visitors - Like, Reply etc.
Show the gender of the message poster, if specified.
Display a link to the home page of the message author, if they have entered one.
Show the message author's location, if they have provided one.
Display the total number of messages posted by the message author.
Show the message poster's occupation, if specified.
Display the date on which the message author signed up.
Display the total number of times content by the message author has been 'liked'.
Display the message poster's total accumulation of trophy points.

The text shown in the body of full-size messages will be controlled by the values set in this property.
It does not apply to small messages, such as profile posts and comments, which use the text styling from 'body'.
This unit directly encloses the avatar, username and other user info for a message.

This container encloses the avatar, username, user title and additional user info elements.
Its primary purpose in the default style is to provide the left column of the message template.
Styling for the name of the person who posted the message.
Styles the container for the author username and user title next to messages.
Controls the appearance of the user title displayed with the message poster's username.
This element entirely surrounds each message.
Controls each individual navigation tab link.
Styles links under the selected navigation tab, in their hover state.
Styles each link in the row of controls below the selected navigation tab.
Styles the currently-selected header navigation tab.
Controls the container for the header navigation tabs.
The triangle / arrow attached to node description tooltips
Controls the display of non-tooltip node description text.
Controls the large icon shown on forum, page and link nodes.
This controls the block of info describing the last post made within a forum (usually) node.
Include descriptions underneath node titles on the main node list.
Show Forum Descriptions on Node List
Show descriptions only when hovering over forum titles on the main node list.
Controls the display of the total number of discussions, messages etc.
This controls the area within which the main text for node display is contained.
Changes to be made to tiny icons when the mouse moves over them
This controls the appearance of small icons such as the RSS feed icon.
Extra properties to apply to node titles when they contain unread content.
Controls the display of non-category node titles
Styles the 'close' gadget that is added when no other control is provided to close an overlay.
Speed in milliseconds for overlays to fade out. Default: 100.
Defines the width of the label area to the left of form control units within overlays.
Form Control Unit Label Width in Overlays
Controls the width of forms using the .xenForm class when being shown in an overlay.
Controls the degree of transparency of the mask applied to the background content when an overlay is shown. Default: 0.6; fully transparent: 0; fully opaque: 1.
This is the property that controls the main container for overlays, including their border and shadow etc.
Speed in milliseconds for overlays to fade in. Default: 200.
Default position of overlays relative to the top of the browser window.
Styles the optional description text that may be presented below the page title.
These rules are applied in addition to the normal page link rules in order to distinguish the current page.

This element is used in instances where a page navigation block is placed alongside a group of links, such as above the list of threads on the forum view, or above the list of messages on thread view.
Controls the amount of space between individual page navigation links.
This width is the basis for all page navigation links.
Used to style each individual page navigation link including pages, next and previous buttons, and the scroll arrows.
Controls the appearance of page links when the mouse hovers over them.
Controls the appearance of the scroll buttons that appear when more than seven pages are available.
The container for the page navigation element, normally controls overall elements such as font size etc.
Points down, indicates the menu can be opened
Indicates that the menu can be closed
Styles the arrow attached to content preview tooltips that points to the content.
This defines the style of the element used for thread, and other content preview tooltips.
Styling for links within primaryContent containers.
Styles text that describes where the user was last active.
Styles the values for fields in sidebar info blocks.
Styles the labels for data in info blocks.
Controls the styling of the outer section of sidebar info blocks.
Specifies the width of the sidebar for the member profile page. This sidebar is usually the same width as the large avatar.
Controls the height of the tabs on the profile page.
Styles profile page tabs when hovered
Controls the amount of indent from the notional left margin to the tabs area.
Additional styling for the selected tab on the profile page.
Styles the tabs at the top of the profile page.
Styles the large heading showing the name of the person whose profile page this is.
Styles the text of the current user status message, if shown.
Styles the outer container for the profile page elements.
Styles the content of redirect messages shown after AJAX submissions.
Styles the container for redirect messages that appear after some forms are submitted with AJAX.
Styling for links within secondaryContent containers.
Footnotes or summary for a section
